meanings.definition: A period of time when a service or utility is not available.
meanings.sent1: During the outage, the power went off in the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The internet outage lasted for hours, causing inconvenience to many people.
meanings.sent3: The outage at the ice cream shop left everyone craving a sweet treat.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden absence created an emotional outage in the team.
meanings.sent5: The outage of phone signal in the mountains made communication impossible.

meanings.definition: The action of stopping the flow or operation of something.
meanings.sent1: The outage of water supply halted the production line at the factory.
meanings.sent2: A sudden outage of traffic brought the busy street to a standstill.
meanings.sent3: The outage of jokes from the comedian left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected apology caused an outage in the ongoing argument.
meanings.sent5: The outage of ideas in the brainstorming session stifled creativity.
